Deadlifts

Deadlifts are one of the most effective strength-building exercises, targeting the entire posterior chain, which includes the muscles along the backside of the body, such as the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back. This compound exercise also strengthens the core and upper body, making it a total-body workout. Deadlifts not only help improve posture by counteracting the effects of prolonged sitting, but they also enhance functional strength, making it easier to perform daily tasks like lifting heavy objects. Proper form is crucial to avoid injury, but when done correctly, deadlifts are an excellent way to build power and stability.
